lexUnit.name: smash.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cause to break into pieces by hitting violently.

sentence.text: As they drove off he threw a concrete block at each car in turn , smashing the rear window of one , cracking the windscreen of the other .
Two of them blocked her exit from the car park while the third smashed the car window to grab her handbag .

A window was smashed at Clemitson 's chemists on North Terrace , Crook , on Sunday night .

` Can you keep the little sucker on your desk a whole day without smashing it to pieces . "
A SEVENTEEN-year-old youth who used a stone flowerpot to smash front windows of three cars parked in Holybourne on the night of January 10th , woke nearby residents with the noise .

THE rear window of a VW Polo parked in Orchard Lane , Alton on Saturday night was smashed by vandals .
